learning.title: Avoiding Misleading Visuals and Ethical Data Use

questions.promptMd: Which practice MOST reduces risk of misleading the audience?

answers.contentMd: Show full axes with baselines unless well‑justified and labeled
Cherry‑pick the most favorable time window
Remove source citations to keep slides clean

questions.promptMd: True or False: De‑identification and consent are core to ethical data use in public presentations.

answers.feedbackMd: Correct. Protect subjects and comply with policy/law.
Privacy is non‑negotiable in ethical practice.

questions.promptMd: Your time window shows a rising trend; adding earlier data reveals a flat decade. What’s the BEST action?

answers.contentMd: Expand to the honest window and explain why the subset looked rising
answers.feedbackMd: Gives full context and preserves trust.

answers.contentMd: Keep the rising window; it’s technically true
answers.feedbackMd: Technically true can still mislead; add context.
Better to present truthfully than hide.

questions.promptMd: True or False: When in doubt, include methods and source links for reproducibility.

answers.feedbackMd: Correct. Transparency improves credibility and review.
